metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5800 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An off-by-one error within the "LibRaw::kodak_ycbcr_load_raw()" function (internal/dcraw_common.cpp) in LibRaw versions prior to 0.18.7 can be exploited to cause a heap-based buffer overflow and subsequently cause a crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5800` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.17.1-1ubuntu0.2
libraw15 - 0.17.1-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: darktable: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
